intro: Thesium ramosum proles divaricatum, commonly known as the slender thesium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Ericaceae. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit with slender, branched stems. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late summer. Its leaves are linear and evergreen, contributing to its ornamental appeal in shaded environments. It is native to parts of Europe and is often found in rocky or woodland soils.
